alert.note: Alert for Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 01 at 2:35AM MDT until August 01 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TODAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, 317, 318, 322, 327, AND 329... .Hot temperatures, very dry air, and breezy northwest winds are expected late this morning into early evening over northeast Wyoming, as well as parts of the far western South Dakota plains. Minimum relative humidities will drop to 8-15%. A surface trough will move through the area today with northwest winds becoming 10-20 MPH with gusts to 25-35 MPH behind the trough. The combination will create critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 318... The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 9 AM this morning to 9 PM MDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 318 Wyoming Black Hills. * WINDS...West 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity will produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
